partners.name: Ministry of Education, Science and Technology
partners.description: The Ministry of Education (MoE) was established in 1951 and was renamed as the Ministry of Education and Sports (MoES) in 2002. It was again renamed as Ministry of Education with the decision of Cabinet in 15 Bhadra 2065 BS. The MoE as the apex body of all educational organizations is responsible for overall development of education in the country. This Ministry is responsible for formulating educational policies and plans and managing and implementing them across the country through the institutions under it.

partners.name: Teach For All
partners.description: The Teach For All network is developing collective leadership in classrooms and communities around the world. Teach For All is a network of 50 independent, locally led and governed partner organizations and a global organization that works to accelerate the network's progress.

partners.name: Surya Nepal Pvt. Ltd.
partners.description: Surya Nepal Private Limited, a leading Nepalese company with a strong commitment to community development, has been a dedicated partner of Teach For Nepal since 2018. As a subsidiary of ITC Limited, India, Surya Nepal has established a robust Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) arm, SNPL Asha, focused on empowering communities through initiatives in education, women's empowerment, agriculture, and social entrepreneurship. By investing significantly in public education, particularly in marginalized regions like Parsa and Tanahun, Surya Nepal has played a pivotal role in improving the quality of education for thousands of students. This partnership has been instrumental in placing Teach For Nepal Fellows in schools across the country, aligning with both organizations' shared vision of a brighter future for Nepal.

partners.name: Golchha Group
partners.description: The Golchha Group, a pioneering industrial group in Nepal, carries a legacy of 100 years. Since its inception, the Golchha family has been venturing into forming the largest company in Nepal that contributes to a significant part of the economy. Anchored by a strong workforce of over 1700 employees and years of trust from millions of loyal customers today, Golchha Group operates over 100 companies within Nepal. It has established a formidable reputation for itself. With over ten decades of entrepreneurial legacy and unceasing acts of altruism, Golchha Group has been transforming the lives of millions of Nepalese and giving wings to their dreams. From the earliest days of Teach For Nepal, Golchha group has been generously supporting Teach For Nepal Movement and its cause.

partners.name: Sarvodaya USA
partners.description: Sarvodaya USA is a nonprofit organization dedicated to building a world of communities based on non-violence, service, and cooperation. Our vision is a world of communities based on non-violence, service, and cooperation. Our mission is to facilitate individual and community development to meet basic human needs, reduce material, social and spiritual poverty, and enhance the quality of life for all.

partners.name: Nepal Rising
partners.description: Nepal Rising (Daayitwa US), a US-based 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, empowers Nepali Americans to drive positive change in Nepal. Nepal Rising fosters collaboration to support relief, rebuilding, and resilience efforts in communities across the country. Currently, Nepal Rising has been supporting five Fellows working in Teach For Nepal placed schools in two districts.

partners.name: Everest Bank Limited
partners.description: Catering to more than 14 lakhs customers, Everest Bank Limited (EBL) is a name you can depend on for professionalized & efficient banking services. Founded in 1994, the Bank has been one of the leading banks of the country and has been catering its services to various segments of the society. With clients from all walks of life, the Bank has helped the nation to develop corporately, agriculturally & industrially. Everest Bank currently supports a Teach For Nepal Fellow from Dhanusa district.

partners.name: Siddhartha Bank Ltd.
partners.description: Siddhartha Bank Limited (SBL) is a leading Nepali bank renowned for its customer-centric approach and digital innovation. Established in 2002, SBL offers a wide range of banking services accessible through both traditional and digital channels. With a strong commitment to corporate social responsibility, the bank actively contributes to Nepal's development. Currently Siddartha Bank supports a Fellow.

partners.name: Daya Foundation
partners.description: Daya Foundation is a registered Nepalese non-profit organization dedicated to empowering local communities. The foundation offers financial, technical, and volunteer support to organizations focused on education, health, and culture. By partnering with schools, hospitals, youth groups, and other non-profits, Daya Foundation aims to enhance their capacity and create sustainable impact. The foundation has provided support to Teach For Nepal's core program during the 2023-2024 fiscal year.

partners.name: Kings College, Nepal
partners.description: Dedicated to provide world class education in Nepal, Kings College is a premiere Business School in Nepal. The college offers BBA and MBA degrees to Nepalese students. Kings College provides scholarships to TFN Fellows to pursue MBA degree.

partners.name: Merojob.com (Career Partner)
partners.description: MeroJob, Nepal's leading job portal, has been connecting job seekers and employers since 2009. With millions of monthly visitors and a vast database of candidates, MeroJob facilitates over 150,000 successful placements. Driven by innovation and exceptional customer service, MeroJob has become the preferred choice for recruitment solutions in Nepal. The dedicated team and robust technology platform ensure a seamless and efficient job search experience. Teach For Nepal and MeroJob has been actively collaborating in identifying and connecting promising young graduates with impactful opportunities, contributing to the nation's development.

partners.name: Vianet Communications
partners.description: Vianet Communications P. Ltd. is one of the leading providers of high speed Internet connectivity and communications solutions for business and individuals in the greater Kathmandu Valley. Established in 1999, Vianet Communications has always remained in the forefront providing reliable and affordable Broadband Internet Services. In 2011 Vianet Communications pioneered in introducing Fiber Optics Internet or commonly known as FTTH internet service and has been successful in connecting the most number of homes and offices with FTTH in the region. We are solely focused on FTTH services and our engineers constantly strive to bring the best product and service package according to our customer needs. Vianet Communications aims to be the service provider that makes future Broadband dream a reality today.

staff_members.name: Swastika Shrestha
staff_members.role: Chief Executive Officer, Co-founder and Director of Training and Support
staff_members.bio: Swastika Shrestha has dedicated her life to developing leadership skills and facilitating life and leadership development among youth in Nepal and the US. She has worked with UNMIN, IUCN, WFP, and UNDP, and currently nurtures leaders at Teach For Nepal to transform classrooms, communities, and the nation.

staff_members.name: Krishna Kumar K.C.
staff_members.bio: Krishna Kumar K.C. has over 24 years of teaching experience in primary and secondary schools in Lalitpur, including 10 years as a Head Teacher in Ashrang. He believes in the power of teachers to overcome educational challenges and is proud to be part of Teach For Nepal's movement to raise the leadership skills of a new generation.

staff_members.name: Khika Prasad Nepal
staff_members.bio: Khika Prasad Nepal transitioned from teaching to the development field, working for over 12 years in various organizations. He holds a Masters of Sociology from Tribhuvan University and finds fulfillment in working with Teach For Nepal, supporting Fellows and community members to bring about real change.

staff_members.name: Ankush Upreti
staff_members.role: Head of Recruitment Selection and Matriculation (TFN Alumni)
staff_members.bio: Ankush Upreti's transformative experience as a TFN Fellow ignited his passion for youth leadership and systemic change in education. In his role, he identifies and nurtures aspiring young leaders to tackle Nepal's educational crisis.

staff_members.name: Madhav Prasad Devkota
staff_members.role: Head of Training & Community Support (TFN Alumni)
staff_members.bio: As a TFN Fellow, Madhav Prasad Devkota aimed to teach more than just Science, including personal hygiene and community sanitation. Now as a Training and Community Support Manager, he guides Fellows to face challenges and become role models.

staff_members.name: Ruma Maharjan
staff_members.bio: Ruma Maharjan believes in equity in education as the key to resolving inequities and biases. After her Fellowship, she joined Teach For Nepal to ensure every child attains quality education, leveraging her experience as a recruiter and Events Manager.

staff_members.name: Rebati Ram (Rafael) Poudel
staff_members.bio: Rebati Ram Poudel has a diverse background in social entrepreneurship, grassroots education reform, and program management. His journey has reinforced his commitment to impactful work in Nepal's development landscape, currently serving as the Development and Partnership Manager at Teach For Nepal.

staff_members.name: Sadhana Shrestha
staff_members.bio: Sadhana Shrestha returned to Nepal after completing her Master's Degree in Germany, driven by a desire to make a difference. As a Selection Coordinator, she selects candidates passionate about making an impact in classrooms and communities at Teach For Nepal.

staff_members.name: Preeti Shrestha
staff_members.bio: Preeti Shrestha has a background in HR and a strong belief in education's ability to unleash human potential. She joined Teach For Nepal as a fellow and now serves as an HR & Administrative Manager, dedicated to the organization's vision.

staff_members.name: Shripa Padhan
staff_members.bio: Shripa Padhan has worked with marginalized communities, leading advocacy and capacity-building initiatives. She joined Teach For Nepal to amplify the voices of changemakers and support their work, driven by the organization's mission of equity, community, and systemic change.

staff_members.name: Shekhar Kumal
staff_members.bio: Shekhar Kumal has over 10 years of experience in financial management, budgeting, and compliance within international development programs. He ensures smooth and efficient financial management at Teach For Nepal, embodying the organization's values.

staff_members.name: Sami Manandhar
staff_members.bio: Sami Manandhar's journey with Teach For Nepal began as a fellow, exploring diverse communities and understanding their needs. Now, he aims to contribute to environmental education, helping children become aware of climate change and empowering them to be part of the solution.

staff_members.name: Jenisha Shakya
staff_members.bio: Jenisha Shakya is an educator and youth development professional with experience in recruitment, leadership, and program management. She rejoined Teach For Nepal to inspire and recruit future leaders who share the vision of transforming education in Nepal.

staff_members.name: Asmita Guragain
staff_members.bio: Asmita Guragain's experience with Teach For Nepal has fueled her determination to drive change and eradicate educational inequalities. As a Recruitment Coordinator, she advocates for the inclusion of dynamic young leaders in the public education system.

staff_members.name: Gaurab Ghimire
staff_members.bio: Gaurab Ghimire felt a strong desire to contribute beyond his Fellowship at Teach For Nepal. In his role, he is passionate about educational equity and committed to helping fellows thrive, supporting them during times of transition and challenge.

staff_members.name: Samikshya Kharel
staff_members.bio: Samikshya Kharel began her journey with Teach For Nepal as an English Fellow, working with students in under-resourced communities. Now, as a Leadership Development Coordinator, she mentors and supports new Fellows to create meaningful impact.

staff_members.name: Lokesh Khadaka
staff_members.bio: Lokesh Khadaka is a purpose-driven community builder and advocate for quality education and youth leadership. He works closely with the Chief Executive Officer to advance Teach For Nepal's mission and vision, striving to build a more just and equitable future.

staff_members.name: Hari Krishna Khatri
staff_members.bio: Hari Krishna Khatri began his career in teaching and later worked in fintech and as a School Coordinator. He joined Teach For Nepal to support and inspire young leaders, believing in the organization's vision of nurturing students as leaders equipped to create positive change.

staff_members.name: Akriti Paudel
staff_members.bio: Akriti Paudel's journey began as a Teach For Nepal Mathematics Fellow in the Himalayas. Her experience fueled her passion for equitable education, and now as a Leadership Development Coordinator, she supports and guides high-potential fellows to create sustainable change.

staff_members.name: Amir Khokhali
staff_members.bio: Amir Khokhali was inspired by TFN Fellows during his school years and now aims to contribute to the organization that shaped his aspirations. He uses his technical skills to support Teach For Nepal's mission of ensuring all children in Nepal receive an excellent education.

staff_members.name: Sirjana Dhital
staff_members.bio: Sirjana Dhital moved to Kathmandu from her village to be closer to her brothers. She has been working at Teach For Nepal since its inception, believing in the importance of providing all children with the opportunity to learn and have a bright future.
